answers.answer: WELCOME to the THYROID COMMUNITY!Anybody jump in .. I don't have the knowledge in the area of your  ? but wanted to say hello.Cheryl

Thyroid disease is often an auto-immune disease, but not always.Auto-immuned diseases tend to accumulate, such that if you have one, the chances of having two or three in ten years are fairly high.I don't think you can say auto-immune thyroid disease is the root of other auto-immune diseases, although in a way it is.You can develop Celiac Sprue and then years later develop Hashimoto's. You can develop Lupus and then farther down the road develop Hashimoto's, and then Rheumatoid Arthritis.Auto-immune thyroid disease does not necessarily precede any other auto-immune disease.At the same time, auto-immune thyroid disease does often lead to further health complications like Rheumatoid Arthritis, Carpel tunnel(sp?), anemia, calcium loss from the bones, reduced blood platelet production in the marrow, diabetes, digestive disorders, chlosterol problems, heart complications, do I need to go on?And many times it is another auto-immune disease.You sound like many of your diseases are tied to thyroid disease. Your test numbers show you Hypothyroid. Do you have a history of thyroid disease?You should have a Free T4 test.Antibody tests; Thyroid Peroxidase antibody (TPOab), and thyroglobulin antibody (TGab)You have the medical picture of someone who has had untreated thyroid problems for a long time.
